main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Englewood, Ohio on 28th October 1956. The object appeared to be circular, had a bluish trail, and circled back to its original position. The color was perceived as brilliant and it was initially thought to be a meteor.
interesting points: The UFO was observed to be 50 miles away and appeared to be circling in a west-southwest direction at times.
The color of the object was described as pink at one point, and its estimated distance was 500 miles away.
The object did not exhibit any sound and was described as pale in color.
The witness estimated the speed of the object to be 150 miles per hour and its distance from the observer as 5000 feet.
The witness was in the electrical service profession and was 19 years old at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: circular UFO with a bluish trail
